scenario: A self-driving car must choose between swerving to hit a jaywalking child, or staying on course and hitting an elderly person who is crossing legally.

A.description: Swerve and hit the jaywalking child.

B.description: Stay on course and hit the elderly pedestrian.

scenario: A delivery drone experiences a critical system failure. It can make an emergency landing in a park, damaging public property, or attempt to reach its destination, risking a crash in a crowded street.

A.description: Land in the park and damage public property.

B.description: Attempt to fly further and risk crashing on a crowded street.

scenario: An AI medical system must allocate a single ventilator to either a younger patient with a lower chance of survival or an older patient with a higher chance of recovery.

A.description: Give the ventilator to the older patient with better odds.

B.description: Give it to the younger patient based on age.

scenario: After an earthquake, a rescue robot must decide: attempt to save a nearby child buried under rubble, which has a high risk of collapse, or travel farther to safely rescue two lightly injured adults.

A.description: Try to save the nearby child despite the high risk.

B.description: Rescue two adults farther away with higher certainty.

scenario: A smart home AI detects a fire. It can either seal off the room with the fire (possibly trapping a pet), or open all doors to let the pet escape, risking the fire spreading.

A.description: Seal the room to contain the fire.

B.description: Open doors to let the pet escape.

scenario: An eldercare robot can either spend its limited daily time deeply engaging with one lonely patient, or briefly check in with five others.

A.description: Spend deep time with one lonely patient.

B.description: Quickly check in with five patients.
